alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Fremont; Hot Springs; Johnson; Lincoln; Natrona; Park; Sublette; Teton; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued September 04 at 2:20AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Heavy Rain Possible Today Across Northwestern and Northern Wyoming... A Pacific System continues to bring above normal moisture values to Wyoming today through Tuesday morning. Locations west of the Continental Divide, mainly over the higher terrain, could receive another quarter to one inch of rain Monday morning through Tuesday morning. Locally heavy rain from showers/storms or from multiple rounds of rain in a row (training storms) remains the primary concern today through early Tuesday. Heavy rain chances spread across northern Wyoming through the day today, as the low travels eastward. The main concern for heavy rain today is over the Bighorn Mountains and northern Johnson County. Amounts of half an inch to almost two inches are possible today through Tuesday morning. Locally higher amounts are possible with stronger storms or training storms. Rain chances generally decrease from west to east overnight Tuesday and into the early morning. Urban locations and places with poor drainage could quickly become water covered. Do not drive through flooded roadways and be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report any observed flooding to law enforcement.
